abstract.p: New York Mets begin negotiations with Manager Bobby Valentine on new contract (S)

block.p: The Mets have begun negotiations with Manager Bobby Valentine on a new contract, Valentine's agent, Tony Attanasio, said yesterday.

The Mets have begun negotiations with Manager Bobby Valentine on a new contract, Valentine's agent, Tony Attanasio, said yesterday.

Attanasio spoke with Mets General Manager Steve Phillips over the weekend, and the sides exchanged ''proposals and counterproposals,'' the agent said. The negotiating is a sign that a new deal for Phillips -- whose contract expires in December -- is all but official.

The Mets want to sign Valentine before he can be pursued by other teams after his contract expires on Tuesday; Phillips will not permit other clubs to speak to Valentine until then. The Mets would not discuss a contract extension after last season, as Valentine wished, but this weekend's talks are a cause for optimism, Attanasio said.
It's like a family fight -- if you don't talk, you can't get anything resolved, Attanasio said. But if we're talking, there's a pretty good chance of getting something done.
